result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

11:02 AM Defendant Cherie Ann Miller appeared by video, in custody from Barron County Jail.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman appeared by video for Cherie Ann Miller.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.   Court reviews the Justice Point violation reports filed.   Justice Point Representative H. Lessard in court, makes statement to court.   Discussion takes place.  Attny Chapman makes statement to court.   State makes statement for bond (additional $500 Cash)  Court addresses DEF, DEF responds.   Court addresses DEF on importance of following conditions of bond.   Warrant quashed.  Court reinstates bond  SIBS $2500 and  modifies to CBS $500 with same conditions.  Attny Chapman request preliminary hearing to be set.  Court sets.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 11:45 am.
